name: SupportFordeAndKyle
_source: speak;Kyle;What are you doing out here?|Are you-|Are you painting?
speak;Forde;No!|I-|Well, yes.|Actually, I'm not so much painting as sketching.|I use this piece of charcoal to draw and shade, like this.
speak;Kyle;You know we're in the middle of a battle, don't you?|What if someone attacks while you're distracted?
speak;Forde;Calm down, calm down.|I just like to keep a record of our battles with these pictures.
speak;Kyle;You're just rationalizing!|You're a cavalier-it's time to start acting like one.
speak;Forde;Fine, fine.|I'll stop.|As you command, Sir Kyle, commander of the Knights of Renais.
speak;Kyle;Oh, brother.|Do you have to make everything so difficult?
speak;Forde;If you don't want the hassle, stop telling me what to do!
speak;Kyle;Then stop fooling around on the battlefield.|Seriously, wasting my time on an idiot like you is just stupid.
speak;Kyle;Nothing!|If you have so much time to waste drawing, let's have a quick spar.
speak;Kyle;Yeah, that's right.|I don't waste time.|I take care of my weapons, my horse, and myself.|And not just that-I also make sure our morale is good and our men are safe.
speak;Forde;You really need to take yourself less seriously.
speak;Kyle;And you need to take your duty MORE seriously.
speak;Forde;Yaaaaaaawn...|Oh, why am I so sleepy?
speak;Kyle;Forde!|Are you falling asleep on the battlefield!?|What is wrong with you, man!?
speak;Forde;What are you so fired up about?|You're really ruining my nap.
speak;Kyle;You have no sense of self-preservation, do you?|What is wrong with you?|You lack even the common sense of an infant, you know that?
speak;Forde;Oh, you're one to talk.|When you were a baby, you were planning out strategies to take over the nursery.|You were stuck up then, and you're stuck up now.|And STILL the ladies liked you!
speak;Kyle;You leave them out of this!|Women have nothing to do with it.

speak;Forde;They don't?|Oh, come on!|Isn't it important to have an heir to carry your standard when you're gone?|Take your sister, Mia-she married into a nice Frelian family, didn't she?|I'm just curious who would ever settle for such an uptight knight as you.|You ever think about that?|You think you might meet her in this war?
speak;Kyle;That's not what I'm here for!

speak;Forde;Ha ha ha ha.|Of course not.|But I bet you're still a ladies' man, huh?|I know you-you're a perfect gentlemen, always nice to the ladies.|I remember when you were little, you were always the first to help when you saw a little girl crying.|You would go running up to lend a hand.|I still remember how impressed I was that you would do that. It was cool.
speak;Kyle;I just could never turn my back on someone in need.|It is what's expected of a knight.
speak;Forde;Yeah, but you weren't a knight yet!
speak;Kyle;Well, it's...|expected of someone who aspires to be a knight, too!
speak;Forde;You've got an answer for everything!|But, I have to admit, you've also got my respect.|You're a good guy.
speak;Forde;What's wrong, Kyle?|You're the one who looks tired this time.
speak;Kyle;Oh, Forde.|It's you.|I was just lost in thought for a moment.|I figured that I could use a little breathing room.|I guess that's why you paint your landscapes, isn't it?
speak;Forde;That's right.|You see it now?|Everyone needs a little space to think, even on the battlefield.

speak;Kyle;Well, I wouldn't go so far as to approve of painting during a battle.|What if the younger soldiers started to copy your example?|However, I see your point.|Everyone needs a way to clear one's head.|So...|How long have you been doing those drawings, anyway?
speak;Kyle;What's the matter?|Forgotten when you started?
speak;Forde;I started drawing and painting when my mother died.
speak;Forde;When I was young, I won a tournament for training swordsmen...
speak;Kyle;I remember that.|I took second place.

speak;Forde;She seemed far more pleased at a picture I'd drawn of her than at my victory.|She kept that picture near her always, and she looked at it often.|She rejoiced more in my skill with the brush than in my skill with the sword.|I never understood why...|Not until recently, at any rate.
speak;Kyle;Your mother was very kind.|I remember that about her.|I'm sorry that she fell ill while you were so young.
speak;Forde;I feel lucky-I have my memories of her, after all.|Franz, though...|He was too little to talk or even walk.|That's why I kept that picture of her hanging in our home.

speak;Kyle;So that's the story behind that picture in your house...|I didn't realize you drew it.|I remember watching you practice swordplay when we were little.|I wanted to be like you, and I was irritated that I didn't practice more.|I got so upset with myself when I lost the tournament to you.|That's why I work so hard to keep practicing and improving my skills.
speak;Forde;Oh, man.|It's not like me to get this introspective.|What is it about you that makes me talk so much?|Come on, let's go.
speak;Kyle;When this whole war is over, teach me how to paint.
speak;Forde;Yeah, all right.|Fine.|But we both have to get out of here alive first.
